availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Crittenden Watkins (Whitley County, KY, Circuit Court clerk, attorney, and farmer)

body.p: Whitley County, Kentucky, farmer, attorney, and court clerk. Whitley County, Kentucky, native. Son of Becker Watkins and Nancy Watkins. Married to Sarah J. King Watkins. Father of W. F. Watkins, Harriett J. Watkins, E. E. Watkins, and Thomas S. Watkins. Farmer for John Berry in Whitley County, Kentucky, in 1850. Clerk of the Whitley Circuit Court in Whitley Court House in 1863. Farmer in Whitley County in 1863. Clerk of the Whitley Circuit Court in 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Whitley County, District 2, p. 423A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Whitley County, Wats Creek, p. 398A.
Annual Report of the Auditor of Public Accounts of the State of Kentucky, for the Fiscal Year Ending October 10, 1865, Legislative Document Series, No. 1 (Frankfort, KY: George D. Prentice, State Printer, 1866), 12.
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), NARA RG 110, Whitley County, KY, October 1863, p. 399.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994058, Whitley County Births.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994058, Whitley County Deaths.
KYR-0001-004-0087.
